description.narrative: The project has three main objectives: To address social exclusion/isolation as a dimension of poverty cycles with the SAN suppliers to increase incomes to producers by 20% and to determine a five-year vision and strategic plan for the organization. Follow ing activities will be implemented in order to achieve the objectives: - social exclusion workshop and training materials- increase capacity to deliver orders and manage administration through training mentoring improvement of marketability of products- Up dating and printing of craft tool book- development of five year vision and strategic plan- Increase inventory at OMBA in order to better respond to the demand of products- marketing trip to Finland and development of marketing materials for Finnish audien ce. OMBA aims at establishing sustainable livelihoods with very remote and marginalised communities through craft development saled and marketing. The organization is registered fair trade organization and member of NACSO. The trust started in 2004 but has over twenty years in working and pioneering in craft sector. OMBAs activities reach over 15 communities and 450 producers in ten regions in Namibia. 95% of the producers are women and over 60% are SAN.
